threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies PowerShell artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies execution artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies Adobe Acrobat artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files. A PDF document is typically used as decoy in a malicious LNK.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects LNK file with suspicious content
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious XORed MSDOS stub message
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific process tree behavior of a "rundll32" execution often linked with potential Qakbot activity.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=RUNDLL32.EXE; Hashes=MD5=EF3179D498793BF4234F708D3BE28633,SHA256=B53F3C0CD32D7F20849850768DA6431E5F876B7BFA61DB0AA0700B02873393FA,IMPHASH=4DB27267734D1576D75C991DC70F68AC; Description=Windows host process (Rundll32); FileVersion=10.0.19041.746 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=powershell  -ex b -w h -noP -nonI -enc  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\RecoverySystem\RecoverySystem.dll",#1 ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Pikabot Fake DLL Extension Execution Via Rundll32.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific process tree behavior linked to "rundll32" executions, wherein the associated DLL lacks a common ".dll" extension, often signaling potential Pikabot activity.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=EF3179D498793BF4234F708D3BE28633,SHA256=B53F3C0CD32D7F20849850768DA6431E5F876B7BFA61DB0AA0700B02873393FA,IMPHASH=4DB27267734D1576D75C991DC70F68AC; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=RUNDLL32.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows host process (Rundll32); FileVersion=10.0.19041.746 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=powershell  -ex b -w h -noP -nonI -enc  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe" "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\RecoverySystem\RecoverySystem.dll",#1 ; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=$StringCompanyOriginalUrl = "https://femundengerdal.no/wp-content/content/December/Original/"
$StringCompanyLoadUrl = "https://femundengerdal.no/wp-content/content/December/Load/"

$StringPDFName = "Technicne_zavdannya_na_kompleksnu_avtomatizaciyu_objekta.pdf"

$StringRandomFolder = Get-Random(

    "RebootSystem", "Word", "Templates",

sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=DLL; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\RecoverySystem\RecoverySystem.dll}
